subject: RE: [junit] how to avoid multiple initialization ?
msgSnippet: Hi, you wnat to one time initialization you write your suite method like this it calls setUp one time and execute all the test methods then finally it calls
messageBody:
Hi,
you wnat to one time initialization you write your
suite method like this it calls setUp one time and
execute all the test methods then finally it calls
tearDowm method.

cod......

public static Test suite() {
//return new TestSuite(MathOperTest.class);
TestSetup setup = new TestSetup( new TestSuite
MathOperTest.class))
{
// This is one time setUp() and one time tearDown()
protected void setUp() {
// initialization code
}
protected void tearDown() {
//cleanup code
}
};
return setup;
}

Regards
kabarnacius

--- Kris Henderson <khenderson@...> wrote: >

> Try something like this:
>
> public class TestMyClass extends TestCase
> {
> private static boolean doSetup = true;
>
> public TestMyClass(java.lang.String testName)
> {
> super(testName);
> }
>
> public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
> {
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
> }
>
> public static Test suite()
> {
> TestSuite suite = new
> TestSuite(TestMyClass.class);
> return suite;
> }
>
> public void setUp()
> {
> if (doSetup)
> {
> doSetup();
> doSetup = false;
> }
> }
>
> public void doSetup()
> {
> }
>
> public void testSomething()
> {
> }
>
> public void testSomethingElse()
> {
> }
> }
>
> Kris
>
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Kireitchik, Valeri
> [mailto:valeri.kireitchik@...]
> > Sent: Sunday, July 20, 2003 11:55 PM
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: [junit] how to avoid multiple
> initialization ?
> >
> >
> > Dear all,
> >
> > could you help in the following:
> >
> > Several test are united in one test class. I want
> some
> > initialization to be done ONCE for all tests. I
> sow only 2
> > possibilities where to place initialization code:
> > 1) setUp() method
> > 2) constructor
> > But both are called n times, where n is number of
> testXXX()
> > methods. For n=2 it looks like:
> > constructor is called
> > constructor is called
> > .setUp is called
> > testOne is called
> > .setUp is called
> > testTwo is called
> >
> > So, could you please advice how to achive one-time
> initialization.
> >
> > // SAMPLE CODE THAT PRODUCES ABOVE OUTPUT
> > package itc_m.pass.test;
> >
> > import junit.framework.*;
> >
> > public class TestOfOneTimeInit extends TestCase {
> >
> > public static Test suite() {
> > return new TestSuite(TestOfOneTimeInit.class);
> > }
> >
> > public TestOfOneTimeInit(){
> > System.out.println("constructor is called");
> > }
> >
> > protected void setUp(){
> > System.out.println("setUp is called");
> > }
> >
> > public void testOne(){
> > System.out.println("testOne is called");
> > }
> >
> > public void testTwo(){
> > System.out.println("testTwo is called");
> > }
> >
> > }
> >
> >
